stanza.line: Farewell thou art too dear for my possessingpossessing
And like enough thou know thy estimateestimate
The charter of thy worth gives thee releasingreleasing
My bonds in thee are all determinatedeterminate
For how do I hold thee but by thy grantinggranting
And for that riches where is my deservingdeserving
The cause of this fair gift in me is wantingwanting
And so my patent back again is swervingswerving
Thy self thou gav thy own worth then not knowingknowing
Or me to whom thou gav it else mistakingmistaking
So thy great gift upon misprision growinggrowing
Comes home again on better judgement makingmaking
Thus have I had thee as a dream doth flatterflatter
